name: ext_R3_Contract_te_valuedItem
title: Cross-version Extension for R3.Contract.term.valuedItem for use in FHIR R5
description: This cross-version extension represents Contract.term.valuedItem from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Contract|3.0.2 for use in FHIR R5.

element.definition: Contract Provision Valued Item List.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contract Term Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Provision Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract ProvisionValued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Total Contract Term Valued Item Value
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Provision Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.
